data.title: tunneling socket could not be established, cause=Parse Error
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

hi.I use atom under the Great FireWall In China and under the proxy network in my company.

my proxy config look like next:

``` bash
http-proxy = "http://user:psw@10.**.0.1:8080/"
https-proxy = "http://user:psw@10.**.0.1:8080/"
proxy = "http://user:psw@10.**.0.1:8080/"
strict-ssl = false
```

But It not work. when I use `apm install` or search packages or themes in atom.it show a error message:

``` bash
 failed
Request for package information failed: tunneling socket could not be established, cause=Parse Error (5 attempts) (ECONNRESET)
```

thanks.
### Versions

atom 1.7.2
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio 2010

data.title: Enable NotificationManager.addError() to handle Error-Objects
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

This would enable just adding an Error-Notification with an Error as parameter and probably saves some developers some seldom Exceptions complaining about the wrong data type of the message.

As a nifty Addon, the Notification could treat `err.stack` as the detail-option.

üç∞ ‚òï 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Deliver an (NodeJS) `Error`-object to `atom.notifications.addError()` as `message`-parameter.

**Expected behavior:** Atom should display the `Error.message` as `message` and `Error.stack` as `detail`.

**Actual behavior:** Atom raises an Exception:

```
Error: Notification must be created with string message: <...>
```
### Versions

```
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.6.4
```

data.title: Add setting to disable vcs integration
data.body:
In addition to this pull request (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11367) I've added a setting to disable the vcs integration completely.

It also solves some other issues like:
- https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/784
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1766
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11632

data.title: :bug: Wait for connection end to get completed data;
data.body: When env contains lots of data,eg: custom `LS_COLORS` or a very long long `PATH`, the connection will receive data multiple times in chunk, need to wait for its end to get completed data

data.title: Indent guides showing up in mini-Text Editors
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Indent guides are showing up in mini-Text Editors now.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open up something that contains a mini-text editor, like find-and-replace, Command Palette, Settings View, etc. etc.
2. Hold down spacebar

**Expected behavior:** Spaces to appear without indent guides

**Actual behavior:** Indent guides appearing

![mini-indent-guides](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/14870651/acd670c8-0ca9-11e6-9c12-d469927d63f1.png)

Refs atom/settings-view#767
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

```
Atom    : 1.9.0-dev-ce4b2fa
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

```
apm  1.9.3
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.0.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

data.title: Tabs open without showing the content of the file
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When clicking on a file in the project tree (single or double clicking) a tab is open with the name of the file (the name being in cursive if is one click, regular if is double-click) but the content of the file is not shown.

After a variable time, the content may be displayed. Sometimes is not displayed even after 2 min (the longest I have waited)

If the same file in the project tree is left-clicked and "Open in New Window" is selected, the content is displayed properly.

This has been tested with atom --safe option and after running atom --clear-window-state with similar results.

The problem don't seems to appear in the first file that is being opened. Only in files afterward.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file from the project's tree
2. Click on a second file of the project's tree (one or double-click)

**Expected behavior:** 
New tab should open and the file content should be displayed

**Actual behavior:** 
A tab is opened with the name of the file as title, but no content is displayed. Content may appear after a variable period of time or not appear at all.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1

Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS
4.2.0-35-generic GNU/Linux
6 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

data.title: Update github-releases to 0.3.2
data.body:
The update to 0.3.1 to 0.3.2 contains two changes:
- Fixes an issue where we were using an outdated version of `prettyjson` that wanted a Node version lower than or equal to 0.11.0, and so would print a warning during every `script/build`
- Fixes an issue where using a proxy would fail to download the Github release ~~(should fix #11525)~~

data.title: cursor in wrong column in soft wrapped line when using tabs
data.body:
### Description

The cursor looks like it is in the (`x`-1)th column to the left of where it actually is. Where `x` is the tab width.
![animation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/97994/14867272/5b2f4090-0c8d-11e6-919c-9b295cb31b9a.gif)

In the above GIF I am pressing the [Backspace] key and the character after the blinking cursor is being deleted then the cursor moves one character to the left
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Type a long string with tabs so the tabs are past the edge of the editor (make sure tabs are used not spaces)
2. Turn on Soft Wrap (`View -> Toggle Soft Wrap` if it isn't on)
3. Turn on Invisible Characters
4. Try to edit the wrapped part of the line

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
Same as editing the non wrapped part of the line

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
The cursor looks like it is the width of a tab - 1 characters to the left of where it actually is
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

OS: Windows 10

data.title: Revert ":arrow_up: apm@1.9.3"
data.body:
This reverts commit 3b204d404f4cb6216bedc0afa9c4035f8245e4a8.

It seems to be causing build failures on Travis and our internal CI.

data.title: File Open Behavior
data.body:
When opening an existing file for editing, sometimes the file replaces already open
tabs.  Other times, a new tab is created.  Began after updating to Atom 1.7.
## Repro Steps
1. Have a project tree open.
2. Open an existing file.
3. Open another existing file by selecting it from the tree, or using the fuzzy finder.

**Expected:** Consistent file open behavior.  
**Actual:** Seemingly random opening.
## Versions
- **Atom:**       1.7.1
- **OS:**         linux 4.5.0-1-ARCH
- **Misc**
  - apm  1.9.2
  - npm  2.13.3
  - node 0.10.40
  - python 3.5.1
  - git 2.8.0

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` v0.7.1.</small>

data.title: rhino-python Atom Package Install Error
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I have a fresh install of the latest version of Atom on Mac OS X 10.11.4. I am attempting to install the package [rhino-python](https://atom.io/users/mcneel) (v.0.8.2, current), resulting in a failure and the appearance of an error message. See below.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download Atom from website.
2. Move Atom to /Applications.
3. Run Atom by double-clicking its icon.
4. Navigate to the Preferences pane --> Packages --> +Install
5. Search for "rhino."
6. Attempt to install "rhino-python," distributed by McNeel, by clicking the Install button.

**Expected behavior:** 

I would expect this to be successful, since the steps taken directly reflect the instructions by the package's developer.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The install fails resulting in the appearance of this message:

```
npm WARN addRemoteGit git+https://git@github.com/vuejs/vue.git#b3c529992e322daa4c3a486137730078edd22ffd resetting remote /Users/bmpietras/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/https-git-github-com-vuejs-vue-git-7c0a9863 because of error: xcrun: error: invalid active developer path (/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools), missing xcrun at: /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/xcrun
npm ERR! git clone --template=/Users/bmpietras/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/_templates --mirror https://git@github.com/vuejs/vue.git /Users/bmpietras/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/https-git-github-com-vuejs-vue-git-7c0a9863: xcrun: error: invalid active developer path (/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools), missing xcrun at: /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/xcrun
npm ERR! Darwin 15.4.0
npm ERR! argv "/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/bin/node" "/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/node_modules/npm/bin/npm-cli.js" "--globalconfig" "/Users/bmpietras/.atom/.apm/.apmrc" "--userconfig" "/Users/bmpietras/.atom/.apmrc" "install" "/private/var/folders/wg/wt3x9xq91cv0dk35m7dwck0m0000gn/T/d-116325-2735-1sw8139/package.tgz" "--target=0.36.8" "--arch=x64"
npm ERR! node v0.10.40
npm ERR! npm  v2.13.3
npm ERR! code 1
npm ERR! Command failed: xcrun: error: invalid active developer path (/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools), missing xcrun at: /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/xcrun
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! If you need help, you may report this error at:
npm ERR!     <https://github.com/npm/npm/issues>
npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /private/var/folders/wg/wt3x9xq91cv0dk35m7dwck0m0000gn/T/apm-install-dir-116325-2735-1rip9z8/npm-debug.log
```

The problem has been reported, as instructed at the NPM repository, to little attention.
### Versions

Atom v. 1.7.2
rhino-python v. 0.8.2

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: ERROR Spawn flake 8 ENOENT
data.body:
Hello. Im a total noob and i just followed Pluralsight course that stated that i need a text editor with text highlighting for python. Thats how i got here: http://www.marinamele.com/install-and-configure-atom-editor-for-python

followed the steps more-or-less,
though i did not use

$ pip install flake8
$ pip install flake8-docstrings
$ apm install linter-flake8

because it did not seem to work, or i dont know how to make it work, so i just used Settings-¬ª install

After the install did not preform 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18697615/14848670/7798c9e2-0c77-11e6-91be-69ddb0f4108e.png)

because i have different error. and i dont know how to get to Atom - open yout init script

So linter-flake8 gives me this pesky error: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18697615/14848331/ca730b0c-0c75-11e6-96c9-dc1ca34633d2.png)

Note that i tried to reinstall the whole atom, run it in administrator mode etc. And its the only package that produces errors. I grabbed some other packages too and they seem fine.

...aand i have no idea how to solve it. I browsed some similar issues here, but i do not understand the answers given. I only suspect that it points to some unexisting file in temp, since i read something similar here and saw this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Vz2fbjIrU4    How should i fix that?

I have windows7,
Atom should be latest, installed it today. 
Tried the debugging manual, but i do not know how to do most of the stuff described there. Like running stuff from terminal. What terminal? cmd? 

So how do i get rid of this error? i do not want to disable the package, because it should catch errors that i am bound to make. 

Please bear with me if i am asking something stupid, or in the wrong place. Im doing my best.
### Prerequisites
- [ X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[After installing Linter-flake8 in Atom I get ENOENT error]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [Install Atom]
2. [Install Linter-flake8]
3. [get enjoying your errors]

**Expected behavior:** [No errors]

**Actual behavior:** [gave error, even after reisntalling the whole thing]

data.title: alt-tab switch to Atom on Windows 10: ~ 5 secs
data.body:
this is a killer, if I have to count to 5 every time I switch back to Atom.  On Amazon EC2 c4.xlarge instance this goes down to 1-2 secs.  Clearly there is an optimization issue here.

Completely fresh install of latest version, no packages apart from the default installs. 

Now I try to uninstall and find the job half done, with at least 2 folders in AppData + .atom

And yes, I know these are already documented issues.  But they need to float up to top priority, because they are definitely app killers.

data.title: text gets pasted twice when using kde mouse cache (paste by middle mouse button)
data.body:
I am using atom on kde5/plasma5 desktop on linux.

When using the mouse cache/clipboard (see below) everything gets pasted double. So for example if the mouse cache contains the text "mouse" it will paste "mousemouse". Using ctrl+z the second "mouse" gets undone and the first remains, so I guess that two paste events are triggered instead of one.

This is happening in Atom 1.6 as well as 1.7 beta versions and is irrespective of the linux distribution used (I tried on opensuse leap and archlinux). Other editors or applications are not effected by this.

For explanation:
By "mouse cache" I mean the kde clipboard function where you just mark a text in any application and can then paste it in any other application by just klicking the middle mouse button (without using ctrl+c and ctrl+v).

The mouse cache is a very convenient feature when developing in kde desktop, so I would love if you could fix this ;-)

data.title: Uncaught Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, open '/Users/beng/Dropbox (Personal)/...
data.body:
1. Opened the "Open" dialogue
2. Selected a file which is a symlink (which is broken)

**Atom Version**: 1.7.2
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

Uncaught Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, open '/Users/beng/Dropbox (Personal)/Uni/Y6/COMP90042/COMP90042'

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:522

Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, open '/Users/beng/Dropbox (Personal)/Uni/Y6/COMP90042/COMP90042'
```

data.title: File Open dialog defaults to directory of active editor or project root if no active editor
data.body:
Based on #6762 and suggestion by @lalomartins:

> if this is a huge project, it might be worth it as a temporary fix to open the file chooser in the direction it was last. So, whenever you select a file using the chooser, store the location as state somewhere, then next time start in the same place, if available. It would already be a lot less annoying, I believe, and that's what browsers do with the ‚Äúsave as‚Äù dialogue.

Also note that the code this replaces (`openOptions.defaultPath = projectPath`) was completely non-functional. Apparently `AtomWindow.projectPath` was removed a while ago, possibly as a result of #770.

data.title: üèá Improve perf for clicking on long buffer rows
data.body:
As discussed in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11539#issuecomment-213368868 by @as-cii, this PR reimplements the `screenPositionforPixelPosition` method in `lines-yardstick.coffee` to use two binary searches to find the position in order to minimize the number of `getBoundingClientRect` calls. The first stage performs a binary search on the text nodes of a row to find the node containing the pixelPosition. The second stage performs a binary search within the text node to find the character that contains the pixelPosition. This improves responsiveness when clicking near the end of a very long line of text.

~~This adds a dependency on [`binary-search-with-index`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/binary-search-with-index), which is my fork of [`binary-search`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/binary-search). This fork passes the index to the comparator which is needed in the `characterComparator`, and also relicenses the package to MIT. The original package was CC0-1.0 and waived all copyrights, so this should be okay.~~

**Update**: The original package accepted my PR, so the only thing preventing us from using it is that its `CC0-1.0` license doesn't pass the [`legal-eagle`](https://github.com/atom/legal-eagle) check. Might be a better idea to patch `legal-eagle` to accept `CC0-1.0` since it does accept public domain.

Resolves #10769

data.title: Remove TextEditor's dependency on assert
data.body:
This is step 5 as laid out by @nathansobo in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10979.

Remove `TextEditor`s dependency on `assert`.

I‚Äôm totally open to debate on how we want to handle this. @atom/core opinions wanted.

data.title: The TextEditor.softTabs-implementation favors SoftTabs over HardTabs
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
  - Yes, there are some open Issues (like #10169) which are related to `softTabs`, but i guess nobody did track down what may go wrong.

> ‚ÑπÔ∏è I open this issue as a result of my investigations on https://github.com/sindresorhus/atom-editorconfig/issues/81.
> I tried to lay this down as condensed as possible - i rely on the codebase of the current master-branch.
- The current `TextEditor.softTabs`-implementation knows two states, being `true` to enable soft tabs and being `false` to enable hard tabs.
- `.softTabs` is amongst others being interpreted by [`.shouldUseSoftTabs()`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/text-editor.coffee#L2618) and the following line (if the softTab-config is set to **auto**):

`@usesSoftTabs() ? defaultValue ? @config.get('editor.softTabs') ? true`

In my understanding this chain will always prefer a `true` over a `false`, respectively a soft tab over a hard tab.

This leads in at least one situation to a unexpected switch of the softTabs-setting: if the user (f.e. by a package) manually sets hard tabs and the handleTokenization is being called afterwards. I couldn't find out when this happens actually, but it happens and breaks [atom-editorconfig](https://github.com/sindresorhus/atom-editorconfig).

üìå  I created a hopefully self-explaining spec: https://gist.github.com/florianb/ccc1ec184b86f139f9cadee71dc26f7b

Give me a hint if i am wrong or if you need more information. I will try to help however i can.

Thanks so far! üç¨

data.title: Opening a file should open a new window if no window present on current Ubuntu workspace
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

On Ubuntu, when opening a file from the file manager in Atom, it will first open a new window on the current workspace (A). Opening a second file opens in the same window in a new tab. This is expected.

After changing to a different workspace (B) in Ubuntu where no Atom window is present and then opening another file, the file will open in the Atom window present on the first workspace (A). However, the expected behavior is that the file is opened in a new window of Atom.

My notion of expected behavior is derived from what is done by Gedit, the default text editor on Ubuntu. It also seems more intuitive to me that the file is opened on the workspace I'm currently viewing, even if Atom is already present on a different workspace. This follows an idea of using different workspaces for different tasks.

Some might disagree with this suggestion, but I would still like to see this as an optional behavior because this issue is one of the most often mentioned by those I know who use Atom.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file in Atom from the file manager in Ubuntu on workspace (A).
2. Change workspace to workspace (B).
3. Open a second file in Atom from the file manager.

**Expected behavior:** Two Atom windows open, one on workspace (A) with the first file and one on workspace (B) with the second file.

**Actual behavior:** One Atom window opened on workspace (A) with both files.
### Versions

Ubuntu 15.10 and Ubuntu 16.04 running Unity 7.

``` bash
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

$¬†apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11+
git 2.7.4
```

data.title: Atom TopMost on VirtualBox Ubuntu Machine
data.body:
### Description

If you run Atom on Ubuntu Trusty or Xenial within a VirtualBox environment under Windows 10, the Atom window has always a topmost state.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install Ubuntu 14.04 / 16.04 VirtualBox VM under Windows 10
2. Install Atom from deb-file.

**Expected behavior:** 
Atom window should not become top most. Other windows like the application switcher are not accessible. 

**Actual behavior:**
Atom window state is top most.
### Versions

1.7.2, 1.8.0-beta2

data.title: Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute 'put' on 'IDBObjectStore': An object could not be cloned.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Periodically seeing the following error pop up in the console.  My session state doesn't seem to be saving as a result.

```
Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Failed to execute 'put' on 'IDBObjectStore': An object could not be cloned.
    at Error (native)
    at dbPromise.then.db (C:\Program Files\Atom\resources\app.asar\src\state-store.js:33:12)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Unsure, unfortunately.  Just started happening out of nowhere.  Perhaps it's because I haven't opened up this particular project since around the beginning of March, which I think is before the new state-store code was added?

**Expected behavior:** No errors, and session state to be saved properly after restarting Atom.

**Actual behavior:** See error above :(.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

```
Atom    : 1.9.0-dev-9175194
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

```
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.0.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

/cc @kuychaco maybe?
